channel.title: Assessment Plan Model on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Assessment Plan Model on OSCAL

item.title: Assessment Plan Model JSON Format Outline
item.description: assessment-plan [1]: {… }uuid [1]: uuid, metadata [1]: {… }, title [1]: markup-line, published [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, last-modified [1]: dateTime-with-timezone, version [1]: string, oscal-version [1]: string, revisions [0 or 1]: [ … ], An array of oscal-metadata-revision objects [1 to ∞]{ title [0 or 1]: markup-line, published [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, last-modified [0 or 1]: dateTime-with-timezone, version [0 or 1]: string, oscal-version [0 or 1]: string, props [0 or 1]: [ … ], An array of property objects [1 to ∞]{

item.title: Assessment Plan Model JSON Format Reference
item.description: OSCAL model OSCAL Assessment Plan Model Version 1.0.0-rc2 JSON Schema oscal_assessment-plan_schema.json XML to JSON converter oscal_assessment-plan_xml-to-json-converter.xsl (How do I use the converter to convert OSCAL XML to JSON?) The OSCAL assessment plan format is used to describe the information typically provided by an assessor during the preparation for an assessment. The root of the OSCAL assessment plan format is assessment-plan. Switch to XML activity formal name Activity Identifies an assessment or related process that can be performed.

item.title: OSCAL Assessment Plan Model XML Format Outline
item.description: <assessment-plan uuid="uuid">… </assessment-plan>[1]<metadata>… </metadata>[1]<title>markup-line</title>[1] <published>datetime-with-timezone</published>[0 or 1] <last-modified>datetime-with-timezone</last-modified>[1] <version>string</version>[1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version>[1] <revisions>… </revisions>[0 or 1]<revision>… </revision>[0 to ∞]<title>markup-line</title>[0 or 1] <published>datetime-with-timezone</published>[0 or 1] <last-modified>datetime-with-timezone</last-modified>[0 or 1] <version>string</version>[0 or 1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version>[0 or 1] <prop name="ncname" uuid="uuid" ns="uri" value="string" class="ncname">… </prop>[0 to ∞]<remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1] </prop> <link href="uri-reference" rel="ncname" media-type="string">… </link>[0 to ∞]<text>markup-line</text>[0 or 1] </link> <remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1] </revision> </revisions> <document-id scheme="uri">string</document-id>[0 to ∞] <prop name="ncname" uuid="uuid" ns="uri" value="string" class="ncname">… </prop>[0 to ∞]<remarks>markup-multiline</remarks>[0 or 1]

item.title: OSCAL Assessment Plan Model XML Format Reference
item.description: OSCAL model OSCAL Assessment Plan Model Version 1.0.0-rc2 XML namespace http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/1.0 XML Schema oscal_assessment-plan_schema.xsd JSON to XML converter oscal_assessment-plan_json-to-xml-converter.xsl (How do I use the converter to convert OSCAL JSON to XML?) The OSCAL assessment plan format is used to describe the information typically provided by an assessor during the preparation for an assessment. The root of the OSCAL assessment plan format is assessment-plan. Switch to JSON activity formal name Activity Identifies an assessment or related process that can be performed.
